SHR Reference Model Version 1.0.0
finding

Element FindingTopic

Documentation:
Base class - independent of context - for all kinds of determinations: questions/answers, conditions, observations, allergies, and other findings. The subject of a finding can be the entire patient, or an entity such as a location body structure, intervention, or condition. Things observed about the subject can include social and behavioral factors, subjective and objective observations, and assessments. In CIMI V0.0.4, FindingTopic has four attributes: result, description, multimedia, and intepretation. In this model, the result is captured as the Value in AssertionTopic and EvaluationResultTopic. Description has been omitted for brevity. Multimedia has not yet come up in modeling discussions, and has been omitted, for now. Interpretation only applies to EvaluationResult (not Condition), and has been introduced in that class.
Ancestors:
  • Locatable
    • StatementTopic
      • FindingTopic
Direct Descendants:
  • AssertionTopic, 
  • EvaluationResultTopic

    • Field Summary

      Properties Defined Constraints Value
      FindingMethod
      The technique used to create the finding, for example, the specific imaging technical, lab test code, or assessment vehicle. In CIMI Version 0.0.4, this attribute is called 'method'.
      DataType
      Cardinality
      FindingMethod
      0..1
